intro: Leptothyrsa, commonly known as the slender-leaved dandelion, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, hairy leaves and produces yellow composite flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Leptothyrsa has a taproot system and is typically short-lived, completing its life cycle within one growing season. Its botanical features make it a common weed in agricultural and garden settings.
